Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Brevinin-2GUb (natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals; XXU; 1S=S, UCSS1a; more AMPs?)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (93.3%) tofrog Brevinin-2GHb, differing only in residues 4 (T vs. I) and 6 (A vs. T).Activity: Active against S. aureus (MIC 64 uM), E. coli (MIC 32 uM), and C. albicans (MIC 64 uM).Toxicity: Poor hemolysis HC50 = 700 uM. It can stimulate the release of insulin, thereby of interest for type 2 diabetes (T2D). Updated 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: onlon JM, Power GJ, Abdel-Wahab YH, Flatt PR, Hu J, Coquet L, Leprince J, Jouenne T, Vaudry H. 2008
Literature Information.Title: A Potent, Non-Toxic Insulin-Releasing Peptide Isolated From an Extract of the Skin of the Asian Frog, Hylarana Guntheri (Anura:Ranidae)
